com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Class TransformTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.BasicTool<SelectionToolDelegate>
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.SelectionTool
        • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.TransformTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, SelectionToolDelegate, Tool, MutableSelection, Selection, MarchingAntsObserver, KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PerspectiveTool, ProjectionTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SlantTool

    public class TransformTool
extends SelectionTool
implements SurfaceInteractionObserver, SelectionToolDelegate
    A SelectionTool whose rectanglular selection frame can be modified by dragging handles that are rendered by the tool at each corner of the frame's bounds.

    • Method Detail

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(Rectangle bounds)
        Creates a selection bounded by the given rectangle. Equivalent to the user clicking and dragging from the top- left to the bottom-right of bounds.
        Overrides:
        createSelection in class SelectionTool
        Parameters:
        bounds - The selection rectangle to create.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(BufferedImage image,
                            Point location)
        Creates a selection containing the given image at the requested location on the canvas. The size of the selection will equal the bounds of the given image.
        Overrides:
        createSelection in class SelectionTool
        Parameters:
        image - The image contained by the selection. Note that the selection bounds will equal the bounds of this image.
        location - The location on the canvas where the selection (and image) will initially appear.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been pressed on a component.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class SelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - The location (relative to the canvas) where the event occurred, taking into account scale, grid and scroll pane complications as appropriate.

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                         Point canvasLoc)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class SelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        canvasLoc - The location (relative to the canvas) where the event occurred, taking into account scale, grid and scroll pane complications as appropriate.

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e,
                          Point canvasLoc)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been released on a component.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class SelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        canvasLoc - The location (relative to the canvas) where the event occurred, taking into account scale, grid and scroll pane complications as appropriate.

      • addPointToSelectionFrame

        public void addPointToSelectionFrame(Point initialPoint,
                                     Point newPoint,
                                     boolean isShiftKeyDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has defined a new point on the selection path.
        Specified by:
        addPointToSelectionFrame in interface SelectionToolDelegate
        Parameters:
        initialPoint - The first point defined by the user (i.e., where the mouse was initially pressed)
        newPoint - A new point to append to the selection path (i.e., where the mouse is now)
        isShiftKeyDown - When true, indicates user is holding the shift key down

      • closeSelectionFrame

        public void closeSelectionFrame(Point finalPoint)
        Invoked to indicate that the given point should be considered the last point in the selection path, and the path shape should be closed.
        Specified by:
        closeSelectionFrame in interface SelectionToolDelegate
        Parameters:
        finalPoint - The final point on the selection path.

      • clearSelectionFrame

        public void clearSelectionFrame()
        Resets the selection frame such that subsequent calls to SelectionToolDelegate.getSelectionFrame() return null.
        Specified by:
        clearSelectionFrame in interface SelectionToolDelegate

      • setSelectionFrame

        public void setSelectionFrame(Shape bounds)
        Creates or replaces the selection frame with the given shape. Note that tools that do not support arbitrary selection shapes (like the marquee tool) will use the bounds of the given shape instead.
        Specified by:
        setSelectionFrame in interface SelectionToolDelegate
        Parameters:
        bounds - The shape or bounds of the new selection frame.

      • getSelectionFrame

        public Shape getSelectionFrame()
        Gets the current selection outline's shape and location, i.e., the path on the canvas where "marching ants" will be drawn.

        Note that the location of the shape's bounds is translated to the selection's location on the canvas. Use Selection.getIdentitySelectionFrame() for a selection outline located at (0, 0) and suitable for testing whether a pixel in the selected image is within the selection shape's mask.

        Specified by:
        getSelectionFrame in interface SelectionToolDelegate
        Specified by:
        getSelectionFrame in interface Selection
        Overrides:
        getSelectionFrame in class SelectionTool
        Returns:
        The selection outline's shape and location on the canvas

      • translateSelectionFrame

        public void translateSelectionFrame(int xDelta,
                                    int yDelta)
        Translates the location of the current selection frame, if one exists.
        Specified by:
        translateSelectionFrame in interface SelectionToolDelegate
        Parameters:
        xDelta - The number of pixels to translate in the x-direction
        yDelta - The number of pixels to translate in the y-direction
